bibl.title: Negotiating Identity: Greek Emporia in the Archaic and Classical Mediterranean.
bibl.note: Diss. The Johns Hopkins Univ. Summary in DA 66 (2005-2006) p. 4137-A. - Uses literary, epigraphic, and archaeological sources to explore identity construction and preservation in diverses communities of traders, from the seventh to the fourth centuries BCE. Examines the negotiation of identity in five different Greek emporia located in geographically diverse areas (including Naukratis in Egypt).
DEMETRIOU Denise A., Negotiating Identity: Greek Emporia in the Archaic and Classical Mediterranean.
